text: Hi! I'm trying to build a SAML integration to access private content. I'm using AWS IAM Identity Center for testing purposes. Users can log in and after that they access content correctly, email is recognized and if I already have a contact with that email I can get all contact data. What I need to do is also to create a contact if I don't have that email in the CRM. Is that possibile? How can I do that, is there any particular attribute I can pass through SAML?

<@U01QVR44MEY> do you happen to know anything useful about this? It seems that within a private page with SSO enabled you can't read simple data like `{{ contact | tojson }}` or `{{ membership_email }}` from the Developer Info (they print `null` or are empty).
I honestly don't think this is currently an option, if a user doesn't exist I would have to imagine that HubSpot would treat it as something that shouldn't get past the block
hi <@U01QVR44MEY> do you know if it's possibile to create a contact in CRM from SAML if we receive a new email address in the attributes?
Yeah through the API this should be totally doable

Looks like this might be an idea on the community for HubSpot to handle automatically: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Automatically-Create-Contacts-when-Logging-in-via-SSO-to/idi-p/1027351>
How can I access to data passed to assertion url?
Right now it appears the only way would be a custom setup using the API
via the standard setup it's not currently possible but if you were to build out a custom saml flow it could be possible but much more involved
of course! sorry it's probably not the exact answer you were hoping for
I'm trying to understand if I can put some code between HubSpot and the IdP but I don't know how to do it

<@U01QVR44MEY> if I check hs-content-membership logs I can get:

domain: correct domain
email: correct email in IdP
eventType: "SSO Login Success"	
datetime: correct datetime	
registered: false (always)	
contactId: contact id if email is in CRM otherwise null	
SSO list IDs: always null

do you know what is "SSO list IDs" and which attribute I need to valorize?

When I have contactId, I can not access to contact data (what Alberto said) from the developer info, if I login with SSO. Even if contact is existing. Is that correct?
